reviewText: Wonderful accounts of animal friends.  Marc Bekoff is an expert in animal behavior.  Heartwarming! Too bad people are not so elegant in their relationships.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Animal Odd Couples" is a documentary about animal emotions in general and strange animal relationships in particular. A goat helping a blind horse, a deer adopting a blind Golden Retriever, a Labrador from a rescue making friends with an orphaned cheetah...you get the picture. My favourite: a black cat and a barn owl. Thank heavens I'm not superstitious, ha ha. One of the scientists featured is the maverick Marc Bekoff, who could broadly be considered "New Age". Magpie funerals, anyone? Superstitious, much?But sure, I don't doubt that animals have emotions, including emotional friendships. If evolution is true, we should expect both a certain continuum and sharp breaks. It seems some people still have a problem with that continuum thing. Besides, if some animals are drawn to humans, why can't different animal species be drawn to each other? What's the deep mystery, really?The subject of odd animal friendships is often sensationalized in the media, but this documentary is pretty solid, and almost a bit "boring". Three stars.

reviewText: This DVD is supposed to be about animals who bond with other animals of a different species, but it really didn't cover that subject as much as I would have liked.  Obvoiusly there are people who enjoyed this video because it received several 5 star reviews, but when I finished watching it, I felt frustrated and perplexed because it wasn't what I expected from the ad and other hype that is online.I pre-ordered this because I saw some clips on You Tube and thought is lookied great.  The notion of cross-species friendships is so interesting, and I was keen to see more of this kind of fun and touching animal interest story.  I thought this would be perfect to show the children in my life But ANIMAL ODD COUPLES would be pretty boring to most kids.  All the best clips from the show can be seen for free on You Tube.Unfortunately, this movie was crammed with stuff that just wasn't interesting - scientist after scientist pontificating about things that are only inportant to them, but boring to the average person.  There was a whole 20 minutes devoted to a study of monkeys in Cuba, and how animals of the same species relate to each other - and since the entire video is only around 60 minutes, I consider it little aside a bit excessive to use up that much time on a subject that wasn't even part of the main point of the story.  It might be OK in the proper movie, but that isn't what this video was supposed to be!  The constant "expert" opinions became very irritating and I just wished they would get back to the stories of animals bonding with members of other species.  After all this study, would you believe that these "smart" scientists finally came to the conclusion that the rest of us have known for centuries?  That animals form friendships and can expericnce genuine emotions????  Gee Whiz!  But we were duly informed that science cannot definitavely state that animals grieve... !  (sigh)  I could have told them that animals do, indeed, grieve when one of my pair of mated doves died.Enough of the scientific wheel spinning already!!!  Just let ordinary people tell us their cool experiences with animals who have formed relationships with members of other species.  The parts that actually stuck to this theme were very good, but it was just bloated with other stuff that was irrelevant to the central idea of interspecies friendships. This is what this video is advertised to be and this is certainly NOT what this video delivered.  It was especially frustrating when they showed frame after frame of animals interacting with other species, and they let most of these stories go by without a single word, while they droned on and on about their studies and such.  In all, only about 4 or 5 interspecies stories were even covered.  I felt so let down.So. anyone watching this video should at least know that you are getting too much dry science and not enough actual stories about animals.  If that is OK with you, then go for it, but it isn't what I bargained for.
summary: It's OK for some people but I was very disappointed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Most of these nice stories involve zoo or other captive programs. One situation involved a goat that led an aging blind horse to a feeding area in the morning and back at night, getting nothing out of it except presumably some sense of self-satisfaction. Another involved a lion and a coyote who loved to play with and be nice to each other; the woman in charge of photography said that at first she thought it was simply a 'nice lion,' then changed her mind after entering the enclosure to film. A goose decided that it was the protector of a slow-moving tortoise.

reviewText: I absolutely loved and enjoyed  this DVD and I wish there were more DVD's like it, as Animals are fascinating creatures of God.  It is my belief that God  should have stopped after creating Animals as he got it completely right for that species.  The reason that I say this is simply because Animals kill only when they need to survive.  The world today has become an angry place and there are too many crimes committed between human beings for no reason at all, most  of the time.  Plus the fact that WE as humans are destroying earth by eliminating all that is great for cohabitation with Nature.I recommend this DVD to all that love animals both adults and children as it is a great education to witness how unlike species of animals coexist in utter friendship.........Sophia

reviewText: This is a wonderful show with good narration from a variety of  experts and entertaining and heartwarming video. It's amazing to see animal pairs, not normally seen together, showing genuine caring and affection for one another.  Some people still believe that animals aren't emotive, but after watching this video even the most entrenched will have to doubt their opinions.
Title: N/A

reviewText: We saw this on PBS and loved it so much we bought two copies---one for us and one for our wonderful veterinarian.  Without anthropomorphizing animals, it shows that love exists even in the most unexpected places and the analysis by scientists seems to indicate that all intelligent creatures feel the need to connect with other creatures, even if they aren't the SAME species!  If you love animals, I'm pretty sure you'll love this video!
